channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US and UK leave Europe furious and confused on China
Biden explains new trilateral partnership with UK and Australia
item.description: President Biden talks about the new effort to help Australia acquire nuclear-powered submarines, a major step toward countering China as he works to build international backing for his approach to Beijing. The announcement came as part of a new trilateral partnership among the United States, Australia and the United Kingdom.

item.title: Here are 5 countries that are opening up and living with Covid
Sanjay Gupta breaks down argument for boosters of Pfizer vaccine
item.description: Chief medial correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta breaks down recent vaccine data from Israel and data from Pfizer that supports the argument for booster shots.

item.title: China faces a potential Lehman moment. Wall Street is unfazed
item.description: The implosion of Lehman Brothers, 13 years ago this week, showed how the collapse of a single entity can send shockwaves around the world.

item.title: Japan's defense minister draws red line in island dispute with China
item.description: Japan is drawing a red line around an island chain also claimed by China, pushing back at Beijing's increasingly aggressive military posturing, and setting the stage for a potential showdown between the region's two biggest powers.

item.title: Ozone hole now bigger than Antarctica after growing 'considerably' in past week
item.description: The hole in the ozone that forms every year over the South Pole is now larger than Antarctica, scientists from the European Union's Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service said Thursday.

item.title: Jaw-dropping moments in WSJ's bombshell Facebook investigation
item.description: This week the Wall Street Journal released a series of scathing articles about Facebook, citing leaked internal documents that detail in remarkably frank terms how the company is not only well aware of its platforms' negative effects on users but also how it has repeatedly failed to address them.

item.title: Timeline of missing 22-year-old Instagram adventurer's whereabouts as authorities continue search
Satellite images reveal North Korea expanding facility used to produce weapons-grade uranium
item.description: New satellite images obtained by CNN reveal North Korea is expanding a key facility capable of enriching uranium for nuclear weapons, renovations that likely indicate the country plans to significantly ramp-up production at this once-dormant site in the near future, according to experts who analyzed the photos.

item.title: See new North Korea images
item.description: New satellite images obtained by CNN reveal North Korea is expanding a key facility capable of enriching uranium for nuclear weapons, renovations that likely indicate the country plans to significantly ramp-up production at this once-dormant site in the near future, according to experts who analyzed the photos. CNN's Alex Marquardt reports.

item.title: Five US senators' decisions on 2022 midterms could shape the race for the majority
item.description: John Thune, the No. 2 Senate Republican, is struggling with a crucial decision: Whether to ask South Dakota voters for six more years in office.

item.title: US lawyer turns himself in on charges connected to $10 million murder-fraud scheme
When did humans start wearing clothes? Discovery in a Moroccan cave sheds some light
item.description: In popular culture, cave men (and women) are often draped in furs, but archaeological evidence of what our Stone Age ancestors actually wore and how they made clothes is thin.

item.title: Popular Hawaii photo spot will be closed forever
item.description: Hawaii's famous Haiku Stairs, sometimes called the Stairway to Heaven, are likely to be removed next year following a Honolulu City Council meeting to discuss ongoing issues with the site.

item.title: Woman hiding from Taliban speaks out: If they find me, I hope they kill me quickly
item.description: CNN's Nic Robertson reports on Afghan women living in fear for their lives due to Taliban threats.

item.title: Nicki Minaj sparks backlash with false Covid vaccine claim
item.description: Trinidad and Tobago Health Minister Terrence Deyalsingh on Wednesday criticized as "false" the claim by American rapper Nicki Minaj that a person on the Caribbean island suffered swollen testicles after receiving a Covid-19 vaccine.

item.title: After 200 years of White men, one of America's oldest cities will choose between two women of color for mayor
item.description: Boston is poised to make history in November with two women of color competing for a mayor's seat that has been occupied by White men for the last 200 years.

item.title: ISIS chief in Sahara killed by French forces, Macron says
item.description: French forces have killed Adnan Abou Walid al Sahraoui, leader of the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISIS-GS), French President Emmanuel Macron announced on Twitter early Thursday.

item.title: Watch part one of Imran Khan's interview with CNN's Becky Anderson
item.description: CNN's Becky Anderson sits down with Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan for an exclusive interview.

item.title: Watch part two of CNN's interview with Imran Khan
item.description: CNN's Becky Anderson sits down with Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan for an exclusive interview in the country's capital Islamabad, where he speaks about his country's relationship with the United States.

item.title: Germany averted possible attack on synagogue, minister says
item.description: German officials on Thursday said a possible Islamist terror attack on a synagogue in the western city of Hagen was averted after authorities were tipped off.

item.title: One million Nigerian children to miss school due to mass kidnappings, UNICEF says
item.description: At least one million Nigerian children could miss school this year as the new term begins amid a rise in mass school kidnappings and insecurity, the United Nations children's agency UNICEF said on Wednesday.

item.title: Jakarta residents win battle for clean air against Indonesian government
item.description: A Jakarta court on Thursday ruled the Indonesian government had failed to uphold citizens' right to clean air, in a landmark judgment campaigners hope will force authorities to take action on the city's notorious smog.

item.title: She survived a suicide bomb. Now her app is helping keep other Afghans safe
item.description: Ehtesab -- which roughly translates to "accountability" -- is an Afghan-created app that verifies instances of explosions, power outages, checkpoints, and other need-to-know information in Kabul. Since the Taliban took control of the city, the app has seen a surge in downloads.

item.title: Three dead and 60 injured in China earthquake
item.description: An earthquake in China's southwestern province of Sichuan left at least three people dead and 60 injured on Thursday, according to state-run media.

item.title: Some Tesla owners are losing trust in Elon Musk's promises of 'full self-driving'
item.description: Frustrated Tesla owners continue to wait for "full self-driving," an expensive and long-delayed software feature that isn't even guaranteed to help their cars' resale values. Some of the company's earliest backers of the "full self-driving" option are even beginning to lose faith in the promise of ever enjoying a truly autonomous Tesla.

item.title: Federal judge blocks Biden administration from expelling migrant families under public health order
item.description: A federal judge blocked the Biden administration from expelling migrant families apprehended at the US-Mexico border under a public health order, according to a Thursday ruling, marking a major defeat for the administration.

item.title: Lawmakers launch investigation into climate crisis disinformation by fossil fuel industry
item.description: The House Oversight and Reform Committee announced Thursday it is launching an investigation into fossil fuel industry disinformation on the climate crisis. The committee invited the heads of six oil companies and major lobbying groups to testify in front of the committee next month.

item.title: Trump proves yet again he's able to reinvent the truth in plain sight, and get away with it
item.description: The Big Lie is already tainting the 2022 and 2024 elections.

item.title: Israel's new plan is to 'shrink,' not solve, the Palestinian conflict. Here's what that looks like
item.description: The new Israeli government that toppled long-serving Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu this summer is full of contradictions. There's pro-peace leftists, pro-settlement right-wingers, pragmatic centrists and even for the first time an Arab Islamist party, all sitting together in one governing coalition. On the most divisive issue -- the Israeli-Palestinian conflict -- there is almost no consensus, which is just how Micah Goodman likes it.

item.title: 'I can't sit by in silence': Lawmaker explains why he is leaving Republican party
item.description: New Hampshire state Rep. Dr. William Marsh tells CNN's Erin Burnett why the anti-vaccine rhetoric among some members in the Republican party has caused him to switch to the Democratic party.

item.title: Fugitive hands himself in after nearly 30 years on the run
item.description: A fugitive who spent nearly 30 years on the run after allegedly using a hacksaw blade and bolt cutters to escape from prison has handed himself into police in Australia.

item.title: Piers Morgan is rejoining Rupert Murdoch's media empire
item.description: After months of speculation, Piers Morgan has made his next move: teaming up with media mogul Rupert Murdoch.

item.title: US Women's National Team players' association calls identical contract proposal 'PR stunts'
item.description: The US Soccer Federation offered the women's and men's national teams identical contracts, a proposal that the United States Women's National Team Players Association (USWNTPA) called "PR stunts."

item.title: Walmart tests self-driving delivery cars
item.description: Walmart is testing a driverless car, in partnership with Ford and Argo AI, that delivers your order straight to your door. HLN's Elizabeth Prann reports.

item.title: Cigarette group takes control of asthma inhaler maker
item.description: Cigarette giant Philip Morris International has taken control of UK inhaler maker Vectura despite objections from health care charities.

item.title: A cave full of ancient Indigenous paintings sold for more than $2 million. The Osage Nation says it belongs to them
item.description: More than 1,000 years ago, Indigenous people journeyed into a dark cave on the land now called Missouri and painted nearly 300 detailed images on its walls.

item.title: Airport has amazing new way to build passenger gates
item.description: Airport gates are usually the last point of solid ground that fliers experience before taking to the skies, but at one US airport this month a remarkable engineering feat saw several gates embark on their own incredible journey.

item.title: Dizzying glass box observatory to open high above New York
item.description: Billed as the "world's most immersive observatory experience," New York's latest observation deck features an all-glass enclosed elevator that travels to over 1,200 feet, transparent glass boxes and a room covered entirely with mirrors.

item.title: See who was crowned winner of 'America's Got Talent' this season
item.description: Dustin Tavella, a magician who used magic to inspire the audience with positivity, won $1 million and a headlining show in Las Vegas.

item.title: Members of Afghan women's youth football team arrive in Pakistan
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's football team have arrived in neighboring Pakistan, the information minister in Islamabad said on Tuesday.

item.title: Lionel Messi's Champions League debut for PSG falls flat against Club Brugge
item.description: The much-hyped trio of Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbapp and Neymar failed to inspire Paris Saint-Germain to victory in its Champions League opener on Wednesday, with the French side being held to a 1-1 draw by Club Brugge.

item.title: What Lil Nas X's world means for hip-hop and queer Black men
item.description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter. To get it in your inbox every week, sign up for free here.

item.title: Wendy Williams tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Production on Wendy Williams eponymous daytime talk show has been postponed as she recovers from a breakthrough case of Covid-19.

item.title: Rare photos show the early years of NASA's space shuttle era
item.description: NASA's first space shuttle was meant to be named Constitution -- a nod to the United States Bicentennial that year. But a write-in campaign by "Star Trek" fans prompted President Gerald Ford to change his mind.

item.title: Workplace cafes can play a role in your weight loss, study finds
item.description: As we head back to work, we again come face to face with delicious diet-breaking temptations we were able to avoid at home.

item.title: Kim Kardashian West saw your Met Gala memes of her
item.description: Just because she couldn't see super well out of that faceless mask doesn't mean Kim Kardashian West didn't notice people having some fun with her Met Gala look this year.

item.title: Surprise unveiling of defense pact with Australia left France furious and EU officials confused
France cancels Washington reception amid submarine spat
item.description: Amid a rift over a new security agreement between the United States, Australia and the United Kingdom, the French Embassy in Washington has canceled a Washington reception and toned down celebrations commemorating a Revolutionary War naval victory by the French that helped the US to win its independence.
